name: libelf

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
libelf lets you read, modify or create ELF object files in an
architecture-independent way. The library takes care of size and endian
issues, e.g. you can process a file for SPARC processors on an Intel-
based system. Note: libelf is no longer maintained and packages that
depend on libelf should migrate to elfutils.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependent_to.name: tau
dependent_to.description:
A portable profiling and tracing toolkit for performance analysis of
parallel programs written in Fortran, C, C++, UPC, Java, Python.

dependent_to.name: llvm-openmp-ompt
dependent_to.description:
The OpenMP subproject provides an OpenMP runtime for use with the OpenMP
implementation in Clang. This branch includes experimental changes for
OMPT, the OpenMP Tools interface

dependent_to.name: fast-global-file-status
dependent_to.description:
provides a scalable mechanism to retrieve such information of a file,
including its degree of distribution or replication and consistency.

dependent_to.name: callpath
dependent_to.description:
Library for representing callpaths consistently in distributed-memory
performance tools.

dependent_to.name: extrae
dependent_to.description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs

dependent_to.name: hsa-rocr-dev
dependent_to.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.

dependent_to.name: atmi
dependent_to.description:
Asynchronous Task and Memory Interface, or ATMI, is a runtime framework
and programming model for heterogeneous CPU-GPU systems. It provides a
consistent, declarative API to create task graphs on CPUs and GPUs
(integrated and discrete).

dependent_to.name: launchmon
dependent_to.description:
Software infrastructure that enables HPC run-time tools to co-locate
tool daemons with a parallel job.

dependent_to.name: llvm-amdgpu
dependent_to.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.

dependent_to.name: libdwarf
dependent_to.description:
The DWARF Debugging Information Format is of interest to programmers
working on compilers and debuggers (and any one interested in reading or
writing DWARF information). It was developed by a committee (known as
the PLSIG at the time) starting around 1991. Starting around 1991 SGI
developed the libdwarf and dwarfdump tools for internal use and as part
of SGI IRIX developer tools. Since that time dwarfdump and libdwarf have
been shipped (as an executable and archive respectively, not source)
with every release of the SGI MIPS/IRIX C compiler.

dependent_to.name: dwz
dependent_to.description: DWZ: A DWARF optimization and duplicate removal tool
